intro: Sonchus sespedalis, commonly known as the hairyleaf sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, followed by small, spiny seed capsules. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
